metadata.title: CVE-2022-43945 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel NFSD implementation prior to versions 5.19.17 and 6.0.2are vulnerable to buffer overflow. NFSD tracks the number of pages held byeach NFSD thread by combining the receive and send buffers of a remoteprocedure call (RPC) into a single array of pages. A client can force thesend buffer to shrink by sending an RPC message over TCP with garbage dataadded at the end of the message. The RPC message with garbage data is stillcorrectly formed according to the specification and is passed forward tohandlers. Vulnerable code in NFSD is not expecting the oversized requestand writes beyond the allocated buffer space.CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-43945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-236-generic - 4.4.0-236.270
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-236-generic - 4.4.0-236.270
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-236-lowlatency - 4.4.0-236.270
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-202-generic - 4.15.0-202.213~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-202-generic - 4.15.0-202.213~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-202-lowlatency - 4.15.0-202.213~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1116-kvm - 4.4.0-1116.126
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1153-aws - 4.4.0-1153.168
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1148-aws - 4.15.0-1148.160~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-azure - 4.15.0-1159.174~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1143-gcp - 4.15.0-1143.159~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1113-oracle - 4.15.0-1113.124~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-236.270').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-202.213~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1116.126').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1153.168').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1148.160~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.174~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1143.159~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1113.124~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
